intro: Geonoma cuneata subsp. guanacastensis, commonly known as the Guanacaste geonoma, is a species of flowering plant in the Arecaceae family. It is native to Central America, particularly found in the tropical regions of Costa Rica and Panama. This plant typically grows as an understory shrub or small tree, often in humid, shaded forest environments. Its leaves are usually alternate, elliptic to ovate in shape, and have a smooth or slightly hairy surface. The inflorescences are compound, bearing small, clustered flowers that are often white or pale yellow in color.
